cards.title: Hello, world!
cards.pre: The most simple thing to do in JavaScript coding is push data to the console.
cards.mid-text: The browser console is a useful tool to examine the state of a program as it's running. You can use JavaScript commands in it to display program variables or simulate some interactions, and you can also print to it from JavaScript code. Let's do that!
cards.post: The code below prints "Hello, world!" to the console. Try editing it to print some other text! (code editor coming soon)

cards.title: Of age?
cards.pre: Without decision making, a computer may as well be a calculator. In JavaScript, we acheive decision making by use of "control flow" statements. Let's explore a few of these and make a simple program!
cards.post: Try modifying the code to check if the user is a legal adult (18 years old), but still too young to drink! Hint: else if can be used in place of the else statement to check a second condition. (code editor coming soon)
